wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the System Overview focused on the Quiz Generator application. Explain its purpose as a full-stack web application that generates quizzes from PDF documents or text input using AI models (GPT-4 via OpenRouter or Mistral 7B via Ollama). Describe the high-level architecture with React frontend and Flask backend, emphasizing the separation of concerns and API-driven interaction. Document the primary use cases for educators, students, and trainers. Include a conceptual diagram illustrating the user interaction flow from input upload to quiz generation and response. Highlight key features such as drag-and-drop PDF upload, text input mode, dual AI model selection, and interactive quiz interface. Provide a brief explanation of the technology stack and deployment workflow using the Makefile and start.sh script. Address common user scenarios and link to setup instructions for beginners.

wiki_catalogs.name: Health Check Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the GET /api/health endpoint in the Quiz Generator application. Document the purpose of this endpoint as a service availability check that returns a simple status response. Specify the HTTP method (GET), URL pattern (/api/health), and response schema with status field. Include example cURL command and expected JSON response. Explain how this endpoint is used for system monitoring and container health checks. Document that no authentication is required and no request parameters are accepted. Address common deployment scenarios where this endpoint is used in load balancer health checks or Kubernetes liveness probes. Provide guidance on extending this endpoint for more comprehensive system checks if needed in future implementations.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the backend API endpoints of the Quiz Generator application. Document the three public endpoints: GET /api/health for health checks, POST /api/upload-pdf for PDF upload and quiz generation, and POST /api/process-text for text-based quiz generation. For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request parameters (including form data and JSON payloads), response schemas with success and error cases, and authentication requirements. Include examples of request and response payloads for typical use cases. Explain the validation rules for input parameters such as num_questions (1-20 range) and model_type (openrouter, ollama-mistral). Document error handling strategies including validation errors (400), server errors (500), and specific error messages for common issues like missing files, empty text, or unsupported file types. Provide guidance on how frontend components invoke these endpoints and handle different response scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Hierarchy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the React component hierarchy in the Quiz Generator application. Start with index.js as the entry point that renders the App component, then detail how App.jsx serves as the main state container managing questions, loading states, errors, and localStorage persistence. Explain how App conditionally renders either PDFUploader for input collection or QuizContainer for quiz presentation based on application state. Document the parent-child relationship between these components and how props like onQuizGenerated, onError, onLoading, and onReset are passed down to enable state synchronization. Include diagrams showing the component tree structure and data flow. Provide code examples from the actual implementation showing event handling, conditional rendering, and useEffect hooks for localStorage integration. Address common issues such as state desynchronization and provide best practices for maintaining clean component boundaries.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the PDF Processing sub-component of the Data Processing Pipeline. Explain the implementation of the extract_text_from_pdf function using pdfplumber, including how text is extracted page by page and formatted with optional page markers. Describe the extract_images_from_pdf function that uses pdf2image to convert PDF pages into PNG images and encode them in base64 format. Document the process_pdf function that orchestrates both text and image extraction, returning a structured dictionary with text, images, and total page count. Include examples of input/output data structures, error handling strategies for corrupted PDFs, and performance considerations when processing large documents. Provide code snippets from the actual implementation showing how page markers are inserted and how images are encoded. Explain integration points with the frontend upload flow and backend AI processing. Address common issues such as missing text in scanned PDFs and memory usage during image conversion.

wiki_catalogs.name: Model Client Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Model Client Implementation in the Quiz Generator backend. Explain the abstract factory pattern used in create_model_client() which returns either OpenRouterClient or OllamaClient based on model_type. Document the ModelClient abstract base class and its contract for generate_quiz_questions(). Detail the OpenRouterClient implementation that leverages GPT-4 via OpenRouter API, including system prompt structure, token optimization strategies (gpt-4o-mini vs gpt-4o selection), error handling for credit limits (402 errors), and JSON parsing resilience. Describe the OllamaClient implementation for local Mistral 7B inference, including connection validation via _check_ollama_available(), timeout handling, model availability checks, and fallback parsing logic for malformed JSON responses. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how these clients are instantiated and used within the backend API flow. Address configuration requirements, performance considerations, and troubleshooting common issues like API key errors, model not found, and timeout exceptions.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDFUploader Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the PDFUploader component, which serves as the primary input interface for the Quiz Generator application. Explain its dual-input functionality supporting both PDF file uploads (with drag-and-drop support) and direct text input. Document the component's state management using React hooks including inputMode, file, text, numQuestions, selectedModel, and dragActive. Detail the event handlers: handleDrag, handleDrop, handleFileChange, and handleSubmit, with emphasis on form validation and error handling. Describe the UI elements including radio buttons for input mode and model selection, file drop zone with visual feedback, textarea for text input, number input with range validation (1-20), and submit button with loading state. Include information about accessibility attributes, data-testid tags for testing, and responsive design considerations. Provide usage examples showing how the component integrates with the backend via Axios calls to /api/upload-pdf and /api/process-text. Explain the configuration options through props: onQuizGenerated, onError, onLoading, and loading. Address common issues such as file type validation (PDF only), handling large files, and API error recovery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Technology Stack section focused on the Quiz Generator application. Detail the frontend technologies including React for UI components, Axios for API communication, and Playwright for end-to-end testing. Document the backend technologies including Flask for API endpoints, pdfplumber for text extraction from PDFs, pdf2image for image extraction, and httpx for HTTP requests to AI services. Explain the AI integration with OpenRouter API for cloud-based GPT-4 processing and Ollama for local Mistral 7B execution. Include the development tools such as Makefile for workflow automation, Git hooks for pre-commit and pre-push validation, and GitHub Actions for CI/CD. Provide version requirements for Python 3.8+ and Node.js 16+. Explain the purpose of each dependency and its role in the system. Include compatibility notes and installation guidance for each technology.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Upload Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the POST /api/upload-pdf endpoint in the Quiz Generator application. Document the HTTP method (POST), URL pattern (/api/upload-pdf), and request format using multipart/form-data. Specify required form fields: 'file' (PDF document), 'num_questions' (integer 1-20), and 'model_type' (openrouter or ollama-mistral). Detail the response schema including success flag, questions array with id, question, options, and correct_answer fields. Document error codes: 400 for missing file, invalid file type, or validation errors; 500 for processing failures. Include example cURL command with file upload and form data. Explain how the frontend PDFUploader component uses Axios to call this endpoint, including configuration for file upload progress and error handling. Address file size limitations (50MB), temporary file storage, and cleanup mechanisms. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like file type errors, large file handling, and timeout scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Model Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Model Processing subsystem of the Quiz Generator. Explain the abstract factory pattern implementation in model_client.py where create_model_client() returns either OpenRouterClient or OllamaClient based on model_type. Document the ModelClient abstract base class and its generate_quiz_questions() method contract. Describe the OpenRouterClient implementation that uses GPT-4 via OpenRouter API with proper error handling for credit limits and JSON parsing, including the system prompt structure and token optimization strategies. Detail the OllamaClient implementation for local Mistral 7B model inference with connection validation, timeout handling, and model availability checks. Explain the normalize_questions() and extract_json_from_response() utility functions for response standardization. For PDF processing, document the pdf_processor.py module's extract_text_from_pdf() using pdfplumber with page markers, extract_images_from_pdf() using pdf2image to convert pages to base64-encoded PNGs, and the process_pdf() orchestrator function. Include examples of how these components integrate with the backend API endpoints and handle different content types.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the state management system in the frontend application. Explain how React's useState and useEffect hooks are used to manage application state across components. Detail the use of component-level state in PDFUploader for input mode, file selection, text input, question count, and model selection. Describe how QuizContainer manages quiz progression state including current question index, user answers, and results display using localStorage for persistence. Document the state lifting pattern where App.jsx holds shared state and provides callback handlers to child components. Include examples of state initialization from localStorage, state updates, and cleanup logic. Illustrate how state changes trigger re-renders and UI updates. Address common pitfalls like stale closures, improper dependency arrays, and localStorage serialization issues. Provide performance optimization tips such as memoization and batched updates where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Model Abstraction Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI Model Abstraction Layer focused on the ModelClient abstract base class and its concrete implementations. Explain the Abstract Factory pattern used in create_model_client to instantiate either OpenRouterClient or OllamaClient based on configuration. Detail the OpenRouterClient implementation including API key management, dynamic model selection between gpt-4o-mini and gpt-4o based on image content, and error handling for credit exhaustion. Describe the OllamaClient implementation with its health check mechanism, timeout configuration, and local model fallback strategy. Document the normalize_questions and extract_json_from_response utility functions that ensure consistent output formatting. Include examples of system prompts used for quiz generation, showing how structured JSON output is enforced. Explain the data flow from processed PDF content to AI-generated quiz questions, including token optimization techniques and response parsing logic. Address configuration requirements, error recovery strategies, and performance differences between cloud and local models.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Processing Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the PDF Processing Module used in the Quiz Generator. Explain the extract_text_from_pdf() function that uses pdfplumber to extract text with optional page markers for structural clarity. Document the extract_images_from_pdf() function that converts PDF pages to base64-encoded PNGs using pdf2image and PIL. Describe the process_pdf() orchestrator function that combines text and image extraction into a unified content object. Include examples of how page markers (e.g., '=== СТРАНИЦА 1 ===') enhance context for AI models and how image extraction supports visual content processing. Explain integration points with the model clients, particularly how text truncation (4000/8000 characters) and image limiting (first 2 images) optimize performance and token usage. Cover error handling for file access issues, malformed PDFs, and image conversion failures. Provide usage examples from the backend API endpoints and discuss performance implications of large PDFs.

wiki_catalogs.name: QuizContainer Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the QuizContainer component that manages the quiz experience after generation. Explain its responsibility in maintaining quiz state including current question index, user answers, and results display using React useState and localStorage for persistence. Detail the useEffect hooks that synchronize state with localStorage and handle question array changes. Describe the navigation logic through handleNext and handlePrevious functions, including automatic result display when the last question is answered. Document the calculateScore function that computes correct answers and percentage. Explain the component's rendering logic: showing the results screen when showResults is true, or the current question via QuizCard otherwise. Cover the progress bar visualization based on current position in the quiz. Include details about the props: questions (array of question objects), and onReset callback. Describe accessibility features, test IDs, and responsive layout. Provide examples of state persistence across page reloads and integration patterns with the QuizCard component. Address edge cases like question array changes during user session and localStorage quota limitations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Getting Started guide focused on the Quiz Generator application. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment, including installing Python 3.8+ and Node.js 16+. Document the process of installing dependencies using the 'make install' command. Explain environment configuration by creating the backend/.env file with OPENROUTER_API_KEY and setting up Ollama for local model processing. Include instructions for installing poppler for image extraction from PDFs. Provide detailed guidance on starting the application using 'make start' and accessing it at http://localhost:3000. Include troubleshooting tips for common setup issues such as port conflicts and missing dependencies. Add a quick start example showing the complete flow from repository clone to running the first quiz generation. Verify all commands against the Makefile and start.sh script to ensure accuracy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Text Processing Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the POST /api/process-text endpoint in the Quiz Generator application. Document the HTTP method (POST), URL pattern (/api/process-text), and request format using JSON payload. Specify required JSON fields: 'text' (string content), 'num_questions' (integer 1-20), and 'model_type' (openrouter or ollama-mistral). Detail the response schema with success flag, questions array containing id, question, options, and correct_answer. Document error codes: 400 for missing text or validation errors; 500 for processing failures. Include example cURL command with JSON payload. Explain how the frontend handles this API call when users input text directly, including state management and loading states. Address content validation rules, text normalization processes, and how empty content is handled. Provide usage examples showing different model selections and question counts. Include performance considerations for processing large text inputs and guidance on implementing client-side input validation before API calls.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Handling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the backend error handling strategy. Detail the centralized exception handling in Flask route decorators with specific handling for ValueError (400) and general Exception (500) cases. Document the validation functions like _validate_quiz_parameters() and allowed_file() that provide early input validation. Explain the error propagation from model clients (OpenRouterClient, OllamaClient) with specialized error messages for API key issues, credit limits, model availability, and timeouts. Describe the file cleanup mechanism that ensures temporary PDF files are removed even when processing fails. Include the warning message for missing OPENROUTER_API_KEY during application startup. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues such as Ollama server not running, invalid API keys, PDF processing failures, and JSON parsing errors. Document the error message structure returned to the frontend and how they're displayed in the user interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the core UI components of the Quiz Generator application. Begin with PDFUploader.jsx, describing its dual-input interface supporting both file upload (with drag-and-drop functionality) and direct text input. Document its form controls for question count and AI model selection, including validation logic and error states. Then cover QuizContainer.jsx, explaining its role in managing quiz navigation, progress tracking, and results calculation. Detail how it coordinates with QuizCard.jsx to display individual questions with answer options. For each component, document props, event handlers, CSS classes, and accessibility features. Include usage examples, visual descriptions, and interaction patterns. Explain responsive design considerations and mobile compatibility. Provide guidance on component customization and extension for different use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quiz Generation Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quiz Generation Pipeline that connects frontend input handling with backend processing. Explain the data transformation flow starting from user input in PDFUploader.jsx, including state management of quiz configuration parameters (number of questions, model type). Document the API request formatting in the frontend and how it maps to backend endpoints in app.py. Describe the orchestration of pdf_processor and model_client components within the backend to generate quizzes. Include examples of actual HTTP request/response payloads, showing how PDF upload and text input modes are handled differently. Explain the sequence of operations from file selection to quiz rendering, including loading states and error feedback mechanisms. Provide insights into user experience considerations such as progress indicators and result persistence via localStorage. Address edge cases like empty PDFs, invalid text input, and network failures during processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: QuizCard Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the QuizCard component responsible for rendering individual quiz questions and managing answer interactions. Explain its role in displaying question text, answer options, progress indicators, and result feedback. Document the component's state management with selectedAnswer and showResult, synchronized with savedAnswer from parent via useEffect. Detail the handleAnswerClick function that captures user responses, validates against the correct answer, and notifies the parent via onAnswer callback with selectedIndex and isCorrect status. Describe the getAnswerClass utility function that determines visual styling based on selection and correctness states. Cover the UI elements: question header with numbering, question text display, answer buttons with letter prefixes (A, B, C, D), and result messaging with emoji indicators. Explain visual feedback mechanisms including correct/incorrect styling, disabled states, and the ✓ mark for correct answers. Include accessibility considerations, data-testid attributes for testing, and responsive design. Provide examples of component usage within QuizContainer and describe customization options for styling and behavior. Address common issues like preventing answer changes after submission and handling edge cases in state synchronization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Frontend Architecture of the Quiz Generator application. Describe the React-based component hierarchy starting from index.js as the entry point, App.jsx as the main container managing application state, and specialized components like PDFUploader.jsx for input handling and QuizContainer.jsx for quiz presentation. Explain the state management approach using React component state and localStorage for session persistence. Document the styling strategy using CSS modules. Illustrate the data flow from user interaction in PDFUploader to quiz generation API calls and result display in QuizContainer. Include diagrams showing component relationships and state propagation. Address responsiveness, accessibility considerations, and error handling in the UI layer. Provide code examples showing prop drilling and event handling patterns used in the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the frontend's API integration with the backend service. Detail how axios is used to make POST requests to /api/upload-pdf and /api/process-text endpoints from within the PDFUploader component. Explain the construction of FormData for file uploads and JSON payloads for text processing, including proper content-type headers. Document error handling strategies for network failures, validation errors, and server-side processing issues. Show how loading states are synchronized between the UI and API calls using the onLoading callback. Illustrate the data transformation from API response to application state in the onQuizGenerated handler. Include code examples showing request/response cycles, timeout handling, and security considerations like avoiding sensitive data exposure. Provide debugging tips for common API integration issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Backend Architecture of the Quiz Generator application. Describe the Flask application structure with app.py serving as the entry point and defining API endpoints. Explain the modular design with pdf_processor.py handling document extraction and model_client.py implementing the abstract factory pattern for AI model clients. Document the request handling flow from API endpoints to PDF processing and AI question generation. Include system context diagrams showing the interaction between Flask, PDF processing libraries, and external AI services. Explain the error handling strategy and response formatting. Address security considerations for API endpoints and input validation. Provide examples of how environment variables control behavior in model_client.py. Discuss scalability considerations for handling large PDF files and concurrent requests.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Quiz Generator application's backend endpoints. Document the POST /api/upload-pdf endpoint including request format (multipart/form-data with PDF file), query parameters (num_questions, model_type), and response schema (quiz questions array with id, question, options, correct_answer). Document the POST /api/process-text endpoint with request body containing text content and configuration parameters. Document the GET /api/health endpoint for service status checking. For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas in JSON format, error codes (400, 500), and example cURL commands. Include usage examples showing how the frontend components call these APIs using Axios. Address rate limiting considerations, authentication requirements (API key in environment variables), and payload size limitations. Provide guidance on error handling and retry logic for frontend implementations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Processing Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Data Processing Pipeline focused on the Quiz Generator application. Explain the complete flow from user input (PDF upload or text entry) through backend processing to quiz generation. Detail the PDF processing stage including text extraction with pdfplumber, image extraction with pdf2image, and content normalization. Describe the AI model client abstraction that routes requests to either OpenRouter or Ollama based on configuration. Document the prompt engineering approach used to generate multiple-choice questions with four options. Include data transformation steps between frontend and backend, including request formatting and response parsing. Provide sequence diagrams showing the interaction between components. Address performance considerations for processing large documents and strategies for handling processing errors. Include examples of actual data payloads at each stage of the pipeline.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Configuration Management focused on the Quiz Generator application. Document all configurable parameters including OPENROUTER_API_KEY for cloud model access, ENABLE_OLLAMA_TESTS for test configuration, and model selection options. Explain the environment variable pattern using .env.example as a template. Detail how configuration values are loaded and validated in the Flask application. Document the Makefile variables and their impact on development workflows. Include guidance on setting up local development versus production environments. Address security best practices for handling API keys and sensitive data. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common configuration issues such as invalid API keys, incorrect model paths, and environment variable loading failures. Include examples of properly configured .env files and validation error messages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Testing Strategy focused on the Quiz Generator application. Document the end-to-end testing approach using Playwright with test files in the frontend/e2e/tests directory. Explain the distinction between mocked API tests (quiz-flow.spec.js, text-input-flow.spec.js) and smoke tests (smoke.spec.js) that use real API integrations. Describe the test automation workflow with Git hooks that run pre-commit syntax checks and pre-push comprehensive tests. Document the CI/CD pipeline configuration in GitHub Actions that automatically runs tests on push and pull requests. Include guidance on running tests locally using Makefile commands and npm scripts. Provide examples of test scenarios covering PDF upload, text input, quiz generation, and result tracking. Address test data management with fixtures and API mocking strategies. Include performance metrics and test coverage expectations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Workflow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Deployment Workflow focused on the Quiz Generator application. Document the local development deployment process using the start.sh script and Makefile commands. Explain the production deployment considerations including environment setup, dependency installation, and service orchestration. Detail the CI/CD pipeline configured in .github/workflows/tests.yml that automates testing and validation on code pushes. Include instructions for setting up deployment environments with proper environment variables and service dependencies. Provide guidance on monitoring and logging for deployed instances. Address rollback procedures and version management. Include examples of deployment commands and expected output. Document the pre-push hook workflow that ensures code quality before deployment. Cover both local development deployment and potential production deployment scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contributing Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Contributing Guide focused on the Quiz Generator application. Document the contribution workflow including creating feature branches from main, keeping changes focused, and opening PRs early for review. Explain the Conventional Commits specification used for commit messages with examples of valid formats (feat(api): add endpoint, fix(parser): handle empty input). Define the scope conventions for different modules (api, ui, etc.). Detail the pull request requirements including description content (what changed, why, how to test). Document the code review expectations and testing requirements for contributions. Include style guidelines emphasizing clarity over cleverness and behavior-preserving refactors. Provide instructions for setting up development tools and running tests before submission. Address the automated checks through Git hooks and CI/CD pipelines.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Troubleshooting Guide focused on the Quiz Generator application. Document common issues and their solutions organized by category: setup problems (Python/Node.js version issues, dependency installation failures), configuration errors (missing .env file, invalid API keys), runtime issues (port conflicts, PDF processing failures), and AI integration problems (OpenRouter rate limits, Ollama connection errors). Include detailed error messages users might encounter and step-by-step resolution procedures. Address testing-specific issues such as failing E2E tests, missing test PDF files, and pre-push hook failures. Provide diagnostic commands for checking service status and logs. Include network troubleshooting tips for API connectivity issues. Offer workarounds for known limitations like PDF size constraints and text length limits. Structure the guide with clear symptom-cause-solution patterns for quick reference.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Overview: Quiz Generator

## 1. Project Introduction

The Quiz Generator is a web application designed to automatically generate quizzes from PDF documents or plain text input. The system leverages both cloud-based and local AI models to create multiple-choice questions, providing users with an interactive quiz experience.

### Purpose Statement
To transform educational content from PDFs or text into interactive quizzes using advanced language models, supporting both cloud (GPT-4 via OpenRouter) and local (Mistral 7B via Ollama) AI processing options.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Enable users to upload PDF documents or input text for quiz generation
- Support dual AI model backends (cloud and local) for question generation
- Provide an intuitive interface for creating and taking quizzes
- Ensure robust testing and automated quality assurance
- Maintain flexibility in deployment and model selection

### Target Audience
- Educators and teachers creating assessments
- Students generating self-testing materials
- Trainers developing educational content
- Developers interested in AI-powered document processing applications

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a clean separation of concerns with a React frontend and Flask backend, connected through a well-defined API interface.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[React Frontend]
    B --> C[Flask Backend]
    C --> D[OpenRouter API]
    C --> E[Ollama Service]
    C --> F[PDF Processing Libraries]
    D --> G[(Cloud AI Models)]
    E --> H[(Local AI Model)]
```

### Design Patterns

The architecture implements several key design patterns:

- **Abstract Factory Pattern**: The `model_client.py` file implements a factory pattern to create different model clients based on type
- **Single Responsibility Principle**: Each component has a focused purpose (PDF processing, model interaction, UI rendering)
- **State Management**: React component state and localStorage for persistence
- **API Gateway Pattern**: The Flask backend serves as a unified interface to multiple AI services

### System Relationships

```mermaid
graph TD
    Frontend[React Frontend] --> Backend[Flask Backend]
    Backend --> OpenRouter[OpenRouter Client]
    Backend --> OllamaClient[Ollama Client]
    Backend --> PDFProcessor[PDF Processor]
    PDFProcessor --> pdfplumber[pdfplumber]
    PDFProcessor --> pdf2image[pdf2image]
    OpenRouter --> GPT4[GPT-4o-mini/GPT-4o]
    OllamaClient --> Mistral[Mistral 7B]
```

### Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    User[User Input] --> Frontend
    Frontend -->|HTTP Request| Backend
    Backend -->|Process PDF| PDFProcessor
    PDFProcessor -->|Extracted Content| Backend
    Backend -->|Generate Questions| ModelClient
    ModelClient -->|API Call| AIModel
    AIModel -->|JSON Response| ModelClient
    ModelClient -->|Normalized Questions| Backend
    Backend -->|JSON Response| Frontend
    Frontend -->|Render Quiz| User
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- Frontend: `frontend/src/index.js` - React application entry point
- Backend: `backend/app.py` - Flask application entry point
- System: `start.sh` - Unified startup script for the entire application

### Core Modules
- `backend/model_client.py` - Abstract interface for AI models with concrete implementations
- `backend/pdf_processor.py` - PDF content extraction and processing
- `frontend/src/components/PDFUploader.jsx` - User interface for input and configuration
- `frontend/src/components/QuizContainer.jsx` - Interactive quiz interface

### Configuration Approach
- Environment variables via `.env` files for API keys and settings
- Makefile for development workflow automation
- Git hooks for pre-commit and pre-push validation
- GitHub Actions for CI/CD pipeline

### External Dependencies
- **Frontend**: React, Axios, Playwright
- **Backend**: Flask, pdfplumber, pdf2image, OpenAI, httpx
- **AI Services**: OpenRouter API, Ollama with Mistral 7B

### Integration Points
- REST API endpoints for PDF upload and text processing
- OpenRouter API integration for cloud-based AI processing
- Ollama API integration for local AI processing
- localStorage for client-side state persistence

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[PDFUploader] --> B[App]
    B --> C[QuizContainer]
    C --> D[LocalStorage]
    A --> E[Backend API]
    E --> F[ModelClient]
    F --> G[OpenRouter]
    F --> H[Ollama]
    E --> I[PDFProcessor]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- PDF document upload with drag-and-drop interface
- Text input mode for direct content entry
- Dual AI model selection (cloud vs. local)
- Multiple-choice question generation (4 options)
- Interactive quiz interface with answer validation
- Results tracking and display
- Local state persistence via localStorage

### Implementation Highlights
- Dynamic model switching between OpenRouter and Ollama
- Comprehensive error handling and user feedback
- Responsive UI with loading states
- Validation for input parameters (question count, file type)
- Automated testing across development workflow

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> PDFUpload: User uploads PDF
    Idle --> TextInput: User enters text
    PDFUpload --> Processing: Submit
    TextInput --> Processing: Submit
    Processing --> Error: Validation failure
    Processing --> Generating: Valid input
    Generating --> OpenRouter: Selected
    Generating --> Ollama: Selected
    OpenRouter --> AwaitingResponse
    Ollama --> AwaitingResponse
    AwaitingResponse --> Success: Questions generated
    AwaitingResponse --> Error: API failure
    Success --> QuizMode: Display questions
    QuizMode --> Results: Complete quiz
    Results --> Idle: Reset
    Error --> Idle: Dismiss
```

### Feature Architecture

The application supports two primary workflows that converge on the same quiz interface:

```mermaid
graph TD
    Start[Application Start] --> ModeSelection
    ModeSelection --> PDFMode[PDF Upload Mode]
    ModeSelection --> TextMode[Text Input Mode]
    
    PDFMode --> FileSelection[Select PDF File]
    FileSelection --> Upload[Upload to Backend]
    
    TextMode --> TextInput[Enter Text Content]
    TextInput --> Submit[Send to Backend]
    
    Upload --> Process[Backend Processing]
    Submit --> Process
    
    Process --> Extract[Extract Text/Images]
    Extract --> Generate[Generate Questions]
    Generate --> SelectModel[Model Selection]
    SelectModel --> OpenRouter{OpenRouter?}
    SelectModel --> Ollama{Ollama?}
    
    OpenRouter -->|Yes| CallOpenRouter[Call OpenRouter API]
    Ollama -->|Yes| CallOllama[Call Ollama API]
    
    CallOpenRouter --> Receive[Receive Questions]
    CallOllama --> Receive
    
    Receive --> Normalize[Normalize Response]
    Normalize --> Store[Store in localStorage]
    Store --> Display[Display Quiz]
    Display --> Interaction[User Interaction]
    Interaction --> Results[Show Results]
    
    Sources:
    - [README.md](README.md)
    - [app.py](backend/app.py)
    - [model_client.py](backend/model_client.py)
    - [pdf_processor.py](backend/pdf_processor.py)
    - [App.jsx](frontend/src/App.jsx)
    - [PDFUploader.jsx](frontend/src/components/PDFUploader.jsx)
</blog>
